intro: Filipendula ulmaria f. glaberrima, commonly known as the smooth meadow sweet, is a flowering plant characterized by its distinctive pink to white inflorescences. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is native to moist meadows and stream banks in Europe and Asia. The plant features lance-shaped leaves with a smooth, glabrous surface, distinguishing it from other forms of Filipendula ulmaria. It produces small, fragrant flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. This subspecies is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported diuretic and anti-inflammatory properties.
